New Records: Haris Rauf took his 100th wicket in T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam put on a match-winning second-wicket partnership of 63.
Mohammad Rizwan finished undefeated on 53 off 53 balls with two fours and a six.
Babar Azam made 33 off as many balls with one four and a six.
Aaron Johnson hit his sixth international fifty, scoring 52 off 44 balls with four boundaries and four sixes.
Mohammad Amir clean-bowled Navneet Dhaliwal with a 141km/h delivery.
Shaheen Shah Afridi got rid of Pargat Singh.
Nicholas Kirton was run out by a superb throw by Imad Wasim.
Haris Rauf sent back Shreyas Movva and Ravinderpal Singh in the space of three balls.
Saad Bin Zafar top-edged Mohammad Amir to Mohammad Rizwan behind the stumps.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan restricted Canada to 106-7 despite Aaron Johnson's fifty.
Pakistan stayed alive at the T20 World Cup with a seven-wicket win over Canada.
Pakistan lost both their first two Group A fixtures before this match.
Canada have two points after a loss to the USA and a 12-run win over Ireland.
India and the USA lead the Group A standings with four points each.
